definition: mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: Heavier rainfall could also cause soil erosion and landslides.
sentences.chinese: 而強降雨也可能導致泥土的腐蝕和山體滑坡。

sentences.english: Landslides and avalanches, they report, were among the most common.
sentences.chinese: 山體滑坡和雪崩也是鳥兒們最常見死亡原因。

sentences.english: In summer, its bluish torso5) wears a delicate crown of snow and stands in the mist.
sentences.chinese: 夏季，黛青色的山體頂着精美的雪冠於雲霧中挺立。

sentences.english: Both of the tunnels in the mountain were professionally masked.
sentences.chinese: 山體裏的兩條隧道都被專業地掩藏起來。

sentences.english: The Naqing landside that is middle-sized hillside landslide has developed on the granite area.
sentences.chinese: 那勤滑坡發育在花崗岩區，屬中型山體滑坡。

sentences.english: The mammoth mountain body held up the ice of the north cold spirit.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的山體擋住了北部的冰寒之氣。

sentences.english: Subsidence and landslides were observed in Sumatra .
sentences.chinese: 沉陷和山體滑坡，觀察在蘇門答臘。

sentences.english: Engineers blast through debris hoping to drain the unstable lake formed during the landslide.
sentences.chinese: 工程師炸通垃圾，以排幹山體滑坡形成的不穩定的湖。

sentences.english: Sunlight from the south leaves north-facing slopes in shadow.
sentences.chinese: 南面照射而來的陽光讓山體北坡被陰影覆蓋。

sentences.english: Chen said no casualties had been reported, but some houses collapsed and landslides occurred.
sentences.chinese: 陳衛銘說並傷亡報告，房屋倒塌，山體也有塌方。

sentences.english: The steel chain slowly surrounds the mountain, deeper and deeper.
sentences.chinese: 鋼鏈就慢慢的圍着山體越嵌越深。

sentences.english: Inside the mountain are projection halls.
sentences.chinese: 山體內部是投影放映廳。

sentences.english: Volcanic mudflows (lahars) poured down rivers and gullies around the intact flanks.
sentences.chinese: 火山泥石流傾瀉到殘留山體周圍的河流和溪谷之中。

sentences.english: Nature fights back immediately with landslide.
sentences.chinese: 馬上遭遇山體滑坡，大自然有仇必報。

sentences.english: Burns said landslides happen all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 伯恩斯說世界各地都會發生山體滑坡。

sentences.english: As its shape resembles a wolf.
sentences.chinese: 因爲山體的形狀像一隻蹲着的狼。

definition: to dig out/to excavate/to scoop out
to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
topography of a mountain/features of a mountain
